data.description:
Watchface που λέει την ώρα "ανθρώπινα" δηλ. δεν λέει "έξι και σαράντα τέσσερα", λέει "Επτά παρά τέταρτο".
Η ένδειξη αλλάζει ανά πεντάλεπτο, 2 λεπτά πριν την ώρα που λέει, δηλαδή στις 6:43 θα δείξει "Επτά παρά τέταρτο" και θα παραμείνει έτσι μέχρι να πάει 6:48 όπου θα δείξει "Επτά παρά δέκα".
Χρειάζεται firmware με ελληνικούς χαρακτήρες που μπορεί να κατεβεί από το http://pebblebits.com/firmware/

data.description:
This is a large-number variant of our popular Odyssey retro-style watchface. 

A configuration window allows you to select white-on-black/black-on-white and day of the week/month/nothing. In 24-hour mode, the date is hidden from 20:00 to 23:59.

If you like this format, check out our other watchfaces, Galaxy, Quark, and Photon Date.

data.description:
The watchface that will puzzle your friends is now in color!

From an original design by RichardG (mypebblefaces.com/concepts/21/45) with some bells and whistles.

Current time is displayed on the 4 last digits of the first line, date is displayed on the first 6 digits of the last line, and last digit of last line shows the battery life (9 = full, 0 = empty).

NEW: You can now chose the date format!

❤ Give us a heart if you like Overload!

data.author: Yuriy Galanter

changelog.release_notes: - Added Pebble 2/Diorite and Timeline Quickview support
- switched to EffectLayer package
- PTR support
- workaround fw 3.6 bug on notification dismissal
- re-enabled international support
- updated app menu images
- initial update for Pebble Timer & colors
Major update of internal graphics library. Should prevent crashes and result in smoother animation.

- Bluetooth disconnect notification is now a configurable option
- More stability improvments
Attempt to fix elusive crash on notifications (double free)

- added Bluetooth disconnect notification
- styled time tiles with rounded corners

- Larger, more clear font to display time
- Option to swap date and day of the week
Fixed inconsistency with loading settings page
Added configurable options to invert color scheme and show/hide battery indicator.
Fixed crash when switching to a different watchface or displaying a notification when flip-animation is still going.
Added bar with Pebble Battery level on top. Bar is outlined when battery full/discharging and filled when Pebble is charging.
Fix for noon displaying as 12am in 12h mode
Added support for 12h/24h mode depending on watch setting.

data.description:
- Old style flip clock with flip animation and digital date. Both 12h and 24h modes supported (depending on setting of the watch)

- Bar on top displays Pebble Battery level (outlined when full/discharging; filled when charging) can be hidden via options.

- Configurable options: 
     * Show/hide battery level
     * Enable/disable Bluetooth status alert,
     * Swap Date and Day of the week
     * Invert color scheme.

- Future version will include configurable colors

latest_release.release_notes: - Added Pebble 2/Diorite and Timeline Quickview support

data.title: Big Flip Clock

data.author: Channel16.me

changelog.release_notes: Fixed issue with settings form on phone.

Channel16 Messenger is a Walkie-Talkie like app for Android, that lets you broadcast audio, text and photo messages to other users in your surroundings. The Channel16 Messenger Watchface, lets you see all other Channel16 users in your area on a cool radar-like view. You can set the range in the phone settings menu, as well as choose between 2 radar views (small, large) and 2 background views (dark, light).

data.description: Channel16 Messenger is a Walkie-Talkie like app for Android, that lets you broadcast audio, text and photo messages to other users in your surroundings. The Channel16 Watchface, lets you see all other Channel16 users in your area on a cool radar like view. You can set the range in the phone menu, as well as choose between 2 radar views (small, large) and 2 background views (dark, light).

data.description:
Did you ever wonder why the 12 is on top? We did!

The hour: the number the short hand points at. 
The minutes: remember what the number the long hand points at means in a normal clock; 3 stands for 15, 10 for 50 etc. A little before 3 means 13 or 14...
Added configuration!

Based on an original concept invented by Yuval Eshet (YESHET) + Fowler's clean Modern design.
data.title: Moderm Chaos

data.author: Mobile to Go

changelog.release_notes:
* menu improvements
* fixed appmessage returns error first occurred in V3.6 of SDK 
* some minor optimizations

SlideDeck now…

* ... runs on (the old) pebble as well as the new pebble time.
* ... supports (only on pebble time) up to 10 color look and feels!
* ... has in addition (only on pebble time) a much better "you tuned your wrist" gesture recognition algorithm.
* ... has as an alternative a tap event recognition control.
* ... provides in the settings now a choice of up to 40+ preconfigured feeds.
* ... supports (only on pebble time) up to 16 feed entries in up to 2 configured feeds.
* ... provides air pressure and wind speed forecast diagrams.
* ... has a new Romanian language resource file.
* ... caches weather and stock data etc. twice the time you configured your reload time.
* ... (hopefully) fixes the still remaining seldom crashes.
* ... has a lot of (layout) improvements.
Bugfix-Release * fixed app crashes caused by buffer overrun in in_received_handler * fixed accelerator gets lost * layout fixes Features * messaging IDs, Tuples are generated into appmessages.h

a lot of improvements:
* 10 stock/ currency values
* toast layer for messages
* reduced memory consumption
* new pebble lib

New features:

Selected configuration settings are now persistent. Means in case InfoWatch or SlideDeck has to restart the look and feel of the app didn't get lost.
Selected data gathered from the internet is cached. Means in case InfoWatch or SlideDeck has to restart weather information, stock remains available (for a reload period) and mustn't be reloaded (from the internet). Let's name it a fast load operation. ;)
Optimizations:

Finalization and use of a new own pebble (GUI) lib was the main topic of this release. Nearly all functionality is now provided by a lib. Two positive consequences: Stability, memory reduction and the opportunity for rapid new app development. ;)

Known problem:

Some special chars are not shown in the news InfoPanel. For example the words with accent and the spanish letter "ñ", doesn't show correctly. I use the pebble system font "FONT_KEY_GOTHIC_14" to show news texts in the normal InfoPanel. Due to this you have to use pebblebits to generate a system font set also covering your local chars.
Sometimes the settings dialog will not open and instead an endless animated gif cycle is shown. This is a pebble app "bug"/ problem. A simple solution is to retry after you opened another setting dialog. Sorry I've no influence and can't fix anything. In case you know how please tell me. :)
fixed iPhone settings are not shown bug

New Features:

* Configurable GPS interface in the settings to set hight accuracy, timeout and location cache age properties. Don't play to much - the default properties worked until now in most cases. ;)
* Up to 3 public holiday names are shown below the calendar.
* The expression "KW" (for calendar week) is now more international. :) In case you have better translations send it to me! Furthermore I'm searching for translations for "Max:" and "Min:".

Optimizations:

* Fully reimplemented the load data algorithm and redesigned some pebble to phone exchange data structures.
* Outsourced further string tokens into resource files - due to this no further memory is necessary in case new translations were added. In case your translation is still missing/ or incorrect, provide the translation to me - (for a small donation) I will add/ correct it.
* Again further memory improvements to get more free space for new functionality - we remain below the 24kb barrier. ;)
* A few layout improvements.

Bugfixes:

* Hopefully I fixed now the "Fix weather forecast got lost" bug.
* Now further special chars will be handled which are not part of the iPhone charset.
* A lot of small fixes not worth to get mentioned in detail. Be happy that they are now gone. ;)

Known problem:

* Sometimes the settings dialog will not open and instead an endless animated gif cycle is shown. This is a pebble app "bug"/ problem. A simple solution is to retry after you opened another setting dialog. Sorry I've no influence and can't fix anything. In case you know how please tell me. :)

A new week a new SlideDeck alias V1.2 is out!. Why in such rapid succession? I've had a little time to wast ;) or much better to do a full code review and to fix a lot of bugs that lurked under the surface until now.

New Features:

* The expression "KW" (for calendar week) is now more international. :) In case you have better translations send it to me! Also I'm searching for translations for "Max:" and "Min:".

Optimizations:

* Fully reimplemented the load data algorithm.
* Outsourced further string tokens into resource files - due to this no further memory is necessary in case new translations were added. In case your translation is still missing/ or incorrect, provide the translation to me - (for a small donation) I will add/ correct it.
* Again further memory improvements to get more free space for new functionality.
* A few layout improvements.

Bugfixes:

* Hopefully I fixed now the "weather forecast got lost" bug.
* Now further special chars will be handled which are not part of the iPhone charset.
* A lot of small fixes not worth to get mentioned in detail. Be happy that they are now gone. ;)

Known problem:

* Sometimes the settings dialog will not open and instead an endless animated gif cycle is shown. This is a pebble app "bug"/ problem. A simple solution is to retry after you opened another setting dialog. Sorry I've no influence and can't fix anything. In case you know how please tell me. :)

New Features:

* Finalized the calendar InfoPanel, showing the today date, KW (means calendar week) and
* all public holidays of the month provided from up to 38 countries/ locations. Thanks to the json service provided by Enrico.
* Added 10 new translations - such as Finnish, Hungarian, Polish, Portuguese, Turkish etc.
* Now also the task names are translated - so far I've had a translation.
* Added "fix weather location" property to disable internal GPS location service.
* Added "disable weather forecast" property.
* Added "disable calendar" property ...
* but in case the calendar isn't shown the status remains. ;)

Optimizations:

* Outsourced translations into resource files - due to this no further memory is necessary in case new translations were added. In case your translation is still missing, provide the translation to me - (for a small donation) I will add it.
* Again further memory improvements to get more free space to get place for new functionality.
* Better and more robust processing javascript side.
* A few layout improvements.
* Better sync between available and at the taskbar shown task.
* Changed some defaults of properties - in particular if it will vibrate when bluetooth connection gets lost.

Bugfixes:

* Fixed "weather got lost" bug.
* Solved the "weather data gets lost in case only the weather InfoPanel is configured" problem.
* Fixed a memory leak occurring in seldom circumstances.
* Solved the "internet data was loaded twice" problem.
* Handled the "Loading page error" message in the settings dialog.
* Now further special chars will be handled which are not part of the iPhone charset.
* A lot of small fixes not worth to get mentioned in detail.

Known problem:

* Sometimes the settings dialog will not open and instead an endless animated gif cycle is shown. This is a pebble app "bug"/ problem. A simple solution is to retry after you opened another setting dialog. Sorry I've no influence and can't fix anything. In case you know how please tell me. :)
* The expression "KW" (for calendar week) isn't international. :| I'll fix it in a later release.

Based on feedback I got in regard to the watchface InfoWatch I’ve implemented a fully new Watchface that addresses special wishes like:

* Usage of system fonts. Due to this on a pebblebits basis e.g. greece fonts will be available for feed texts.
* Bigger fonts and display for News, Stocks etc. that will help older people or people with poor eyesight to read the content.
* Extended news texts.
* Optimized accelerator control. Now demanded information is available without e.g. pressing two buttons – you only have to rotate your wrist.
* Optimized error reporting that shows in an understandable manner the state of the spluttering pebble app. ;)

The newly born SlideDesk V1.0 will be a parallel product to the InfoWatch V3.0. For example it not offers 

* … fixed info panels.
* … according to the memory bounds the third feed got lost.

Even through the remaining functionality is quite the same both products will evolve in different directions: Whereas the InfoWatch is designed to provide short and more information the SlideDeck was developed to provide long, detailed but less information.

data.description: A smart watchface with a lot of information gathered from internet. Rather additive the time, day, date (in nearly any language), the bluetooth connection as well as the battery state is shown. InfoPanels are switched in 60 sec delay, by tap event or by accelerator control. Implemented Panels show the weather, the sun/ wind/ air pressure/ wind speed forecast of your current location, stock/ currency values and up to 2 news feeds/ google alerts. The watchface is fully configurable in it's settings dialog. Have fun!

latest_release.release_notes:
* menu improvements
* fixed appmessage returns error first occurred in V3.6 of SDK 
* some minor optimizations

data.title: SlideDeck

data.description:
This is a watch face that keeps the information you need simple and readable.

It displays:
- Battery Level/Status (Charging/Discharging)
- Bluetooth Connection (On/Off)
- Time (Hour/Minutes/Seconds)
- Date (Name of day/Month/Day/Year)

You can customize:
- 12 or 24 hour time (Based off of your system settings)

data.description:
Cool Weather displays a more realistic view of the weather instead of a small weather icon.

Flick your wrist to animate the screen. Shaking the Pebble will show a weather description and the last time updated.

Customizations include the weather service (OpenWeatherMap, Yahoo, NOAA, Forecast.io, Weather Underground), seven languages, fixed or GPS location, temperature scale, battery, vibration, animation, and more.

data.description: A watchface showing fuzzy time, such as "Ten to two." in complete sentences. It also shows the date in a similar manner. The time displayed is always approximate - the actual time is rounded up to the closest full five minute mark. This version shows time and date in english.

data.description:
Mechanism is dedicated to all of the luxury watch fans out there who like to see the gears turning. Based on the Zenith Pilot Montre d’Aeronef Type 20 Tourbillon Watch, Mechanism is the fancy watchface you've been waiting for. Select it when attending black-tie galas, discussing the finer points of horology, or meeting the Queen.

Bluetooth icon changes to star upon disconnect.

data.author: Justin Hamilton

changelog.release_notes: Added bluetooth monitor, changed startup animations, changed battery monitor a bit.

Faster Startup Animation
New Menu Image!

Changed the battery monitor
Changed the startup actions

Changes to the battery monitor:
On plugin and unplug, the battery percentage appears for 3 seconds.
When the battery is fully charged, the charging notification now shows "CHARGED" instead of "CHARGING".

Tweaked a few animations as well.

Added a new charging notification, which appears at the top, instead of replacing the battery percentage.
Minor bugfixes.
This release adds new startup animations.
I removed the bluetooth connection monitor until I can make it more stable. It was too buggy to be included in the public release.
This update includes a date display, and a bluetooth disconnect notification (Still a bit buggy on reconnection, but it's reliable).

data.description:
This is a watchface that fills a quarter of the screen with the opposite color every 15 seconds.
On a shake, the battery and date are displayed, and a charging notification is shown on plugin.

The animation code is a modification of Bonsitm's Split Horizon watchface.
The battery code is a modification of Pebble's Classio Battery Connection watchface.

latest_release.release_notes: Added bluetooth monitor, changed startup animations, changed battery monitor a bit.

data.title: Fill

data.description: Basic Watchface with weather in (celsius), date, time, and location displayed easily. If you have any suggestions or things I could do differently feel free to contact me with your ideas.

data.title: Pebble Drive (Celsius)

data.author: David Rodríguez Rincón
data.description:
Based on the original concept and design by Scott Theuer, in honor of the launch of the Pilot’s Discretion on her three hour tour of the Caribbean.

The use of bells to mark the time stems from the period when seamen could not afford a personal time piece (i.e. a watch). The bell marks the hours of the watch in half-hour increments. 

Dedicated to all the Sailors, in active or retired.
data.title: Dinghy Time

data.author: Will Norvelle

changelog.release_notes: This is the very first release and my first Watchface.

data.description: This is just the standard Simplicity Watchface with minor visual enhancements. The majority of code should be attributed to Pebble.

data.author: Torsten Wunderlich

changelog.release_notes: removed some forgotten debug info
Initial release

data.description:
The Mengenlehreuhr was situated in the middle of the Kurfürstendamm in Berlin, Germany. I can still remember my Mom and Dad explaining how to read it. My Grandma always peeked at her watch to tell the time :-)
The rows read as follows
- the dot flashes once every 2 seconds
- 1 rect = 5 hours
- 1 rect = 1 hour
- 1 rect = 5 minutes
- 1 rect = 1 minute
Add it all up for the time.
data.title: Mengenlehreuhr

data.author: Månster Design
data.description:
This watchface is all you need :-)  
It shows the time in a sleek display and when tapped a second display shows time, date, week, battery & Bluetooth stats + current weather at your location. To avoid to many weather polls the max number is 3. When consumed, a new poll can be made (by tapping) after 1hr. The watchface has Goodtime and Timeburner font + 8 different animation.  
 
Enjoy!
data.title: T2Time

data.description: A minimal watchface, displaying time, date, and power reserve.  The power reserve is indicated by the dots along the bottom; more dots means more power remaining.  Not terribly original; rather API example code kluged together to make it do what I wanted.  Only changes the watch face on the minute, so battery life is good.  Originally created to help my nieces learn military time.

latest_release.release_notes: modified battery meter to read as a percentage rather than dots; fixed a bug in the display when charging event fires.

data.author: Jared Biehler

changelog.release_notes:
Yahoo is out, Weather Underground is in (for current conditions). 
Added newly required API key for Open Weather API and restored functionality. 

As Weather Underground is now the default option for current conditions, an API key is now required.

Battery life improvements! 

- Now waking up every minute rather than every second for drawing updates
- Checking for weather updates every 30 minutes rather than every 15 minutes
Unfortunately the 2.4 update to Pebble causes this app to crash. I've reduced the amount of memory requested for the in and outboxes which seems to free up enough space for the app to work correctly.
Initial Release!

data.description:
Weather Underground current conditions and hourly forecasts* wrapped in a Futura Weather design.
 
- Configurable weather data services (Weather Underground, Open Weather API) 
- Updates every 15 mins
- Configurable battery status indicator 
- Configurable weather scale (°F/°C)

*requires free API key

This app is open source! Checkout the codebase in the link provided below. Feedback welcome!

latest_release.release_notes:
Yahoo is out, Weather Underground is in (for current conditions). 
Added newly required API key for Open Weather API and restored functionality. 

As Weather Underground is now the default option for current conditions, an API key is now required.

data.description: Move helps you break out of the bad habit of sitting for too long by reminding you to take a break and move around every 40 minutes. When the watch face is active it counts down to your next break. During break mode it makes sure you actually move or continues to gently remind you until you do. Use Move during any activity that you may forget to get up and move. Make a healthy change to your life.
